abstract.p: Howard Goldberg reviews 1999 white merlot, 1999 white zinfandels and 1998 Rose de Saignee wines from Beringer winery; photo (M)

block.p: Beringer's loving treatment of its minor wines shows why it is one of California's top-tier producers.

Its deftness is especially displayed in four chill-lightly summer roses, which are in the same family, the Charmers: the '99 white merlot, the '99 LVS (Limited Vineyard Selection) white zinfandel, the '98 Rose de Saignee and the '99 white zinfandel.
Beringer's loving treatment of its minor wines shows why it is one of California's top-tier producers.

Its deftness is especially displayed in four chill-lightly summer roses, which are in the same family, the Charmers: the '99 white merlot, the '99 LVS (Limited Vineyard Selection) white zinfandel, the '98 Rose de Saignee and the '99 white zinfandel.

The white merlot (Beringer's first) -- a seductive flirt that seems sweet but by sleight-of-winemaker's hand is dry -- is brilliant. The lovely prom-corsage aromatics in the foreground, tropical fruits and herbal currents in the background, piquantly endless finish and overall brio would add up, in some critics' scoring philosophies, to a 92.

In the LVS blend, the pleasures of chiffon-weight zinfandel (80 percent) are accompanied by the seriousness of barrel-fermented chardonnay (20 percent). Subdued but ample, tart in a cranberry way, the wine though dry seems an iota sweet.

To understand the berryish Rose de Saignee, think of Maurice Chevalier singing, ''Thank Heaven for Little Girls.'' Urbane, Gallic, semi-serious, captivating. The main grape is pinot noir, hence the red's Burgundian cast (syrah and grenache play supporting roles in the recipe).

The near-dry ''simple'' white zinfandel, a succulent tropical-fruit compote of strawberries, pears and citrus, is Queen of the Noshes. Its newborn freshness, balance and panache are lovely. In its class -- remember, Fragonard is not Chardin -- it rates a 98.

The white merlot costs $6 at Shopping Center Wine and Liquor, Cortlandt Manor; LVS white zinfandel goes for $10 at Ginny's in Jefferson Valley; the white zinfandel, about $6, is almost everywhere; Rose de Saignee can be ordered from the distributor, Cazanove-Opici.
